intro: Biscutella dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its roots are fleshy and store water, helping it survive in arid environments. Biscutella dilatata is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
